resources.string:
About me

 I am a highly motivated and driven individual, having largely self-financed my degree through my part-time employment, and lived independently since I was seventeen. I developed a great passion for the financial sector since commencing my studies in mathematics and holding financial responsibilities through employment.

 About my job

 I currently work in the Client Services department within Fidelity. Customers are crucial to any business, without a customer you have no trade, and with no trade you have no business. For this reason it is vital that organisations are ensuring that customers who use their product or service are satisfied with the service they receive with any interaction they have with the business in question. In this modern technological age a bad reputation can spread extremely quickly and the consumers’ expectation of excellence is growing constantly. This means that just “satisfying” your customer is no longer adequate and the desire for superior service is ever increasing. If utilised correctly, customer service can become an invaluable resource for the growth of your business.

 Why I chose the apprenticeship

 I chose this apprenticeship as I have always had a keen interest in the financial sector and this apprenticeship gave me the unique opportunity to earn as I learn. It also have given me amazing exposure to the sector and helped both my personal and professional development.

 Most challenging thing about the program

 Overall the program is amazing however there are some challenges, the biggest one for me is balancing my college and my work. It’s important to remember that both are important and to manage my time effectively.
